intro: Euphrasia salisburgensis proles soyeri, commonly known as the Salzburg sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive hooded structure. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
